content: Sandeep KumarSearch this siteEmbedded FilesSkip to main contentSkip to navigationSandeep Kumar, Ph.D.Associate Professor,Department of Electrical Engineering,Â School of Artificial Intelligence (joint appointment),Bharti School of Telecommunication Technology and Management (affiliate)Indian Institute of TechnologyÂ  Delhi (IIT Delhi).Phone: (+91)-11-2659-8734Â Office: Block II, 413 B.Email:Â  Â  k firstnameÂ  @Â  iitd dot ac dot inMISN Lab: https://misn.iitd.ac.in/Â Outreach Activities :https://aimlindustry.iitd.ac.in/Â Sandeep Kumar is an associate professor in the Department of Electrical Engineering and School of Artificial Intelligence (ScAI) Â at the Indian Institute of Technology Delhi (IIT Delhi). He heads the Machine Intelligence Signals and Networks (MISN) lab at IIT Delhi. His current research focuses on graphical models, manifolds, semi-supervised learning, and large-scale optimization. He received his M.Tech and Ph.D. degrees from the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT), Kanpur, and completed his postdoc from the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology.Research: I supervise the Machine Intelligence Signals and Networks (MISN) Lab at IIT Delhi. The overarching theme of our research efforts lies in the coherent interaction between optimization, machine learning, signal processing, and graphical models.Â  Specific problems of interest include:Graph CompressionMachine Learning over non-Euclidean SpacesFair Federated Personalized Graph Neural NetworksApplications of Graph ML in Earth science, Neuroscience, Wireless communication, and Circuit DesignAI for Tribal LanguagesRecent Updates:Our paper "Modularity Aided Consistent Attributed Graph Clustering via Coarsening" has been accepted to TMLR 2025. Congratulations to Yukti, Samarth, and Manoj!Our paper "GOTHAM: Graph Class Incremental Learning Framework under Weak Supervision" has been accepted to TMLR 2025. Congratulations to Aditya!Our paper "An Efficient Framework for Epidemiological Parameter Estimation via Graph Reduction and Graph Neural Networks" has been accepted to ACM TKDD 2025.
